meanings.definition: The act of making something subjective.
meanings.sent1: Her subjectivization of the painting made her see it in a different light.
meanings.sent2: The subjectivization of art can lead to diverse interpretations.
meanings.sent3: His subjectivization of the movie plot made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The subjectivization of reality can alter our perceptions drastically.
meanings.sent5: Through subjectivization, each person views the world uniquely.

meanings.definition: The process of interpreting or perceiving something based on personal feelings or opinions.
meanings.sent1: The subjectivization of the data led to different conclusions.
meanings.sent2: Subjectivization can influence how we understand literature.
meanings.sent3: Their subjectivization of the weather forecast was surprisingly accurate.
meanings.sent4: In the subjectivization of history, biases can distort the truth.
meanings.sent5: Through subjectivization, we see the world through our own lens.
